This report presents 2 key findings from an analysis of lex. The analysis addressed 3 questions focused on exploring patterns, relationships, and insights within the data.

*Interactive table available in HTML version*

The life expectancy dataset has been transformed from wide format to long format, resulting in 58,394 observations across 4 variables: country code, country name, year, and life expectancy. The data spans from 1800 onwards, with early records showing Afghanistan's life expectancy around 28 years in the early 19th century.

![](plot_1765483569850_1_0.svg)

This visualization tracks life expectancy trends for the five countries that achieved the greatest improvements between 1910 and 2025. South Korea leads with a remarkable 60.7-year gain (from 22.9 to 83.6 years), followed by North Korea, Bangladesh, Iran, and Kuwait, all showing dramatic upward trajectories particularly accelerating after mid-century, reflecting major advances in healthcare, nutrition, and living standards across these diverse nations.
